results.title: Festival in Edinburgh
results.creator_credit: Howard Thomas, Associated British-Pathe and Douglas Clarke
results.brief_description: Scenes from the 1954 Edinburgh Festival of music and drama, including a short sequence showing Margot Fonteyn and Michael Somes dancing ‘The Firebird’, Ann Todd and Paul Rogers in a scene from Macbeth, Sir Adrian Boult conducting the National Youth Orchestra and before the castle.

results.title: Festival Casals 1970: Pablo Casals conducting
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency and Ken Sale
results.brief_description: Spanish born cellist Pablo casals is filmed here conducting a rehearsal of Beethoven’s 7th Symphony in preparation for the annual Casals Festival at San Juan, Puerto Rico. The film concentrates on the 94 year old Casals’ gestures and speech as he conducts, and interrupts to correct the playing of the orchestra during the opening to the first movement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States Information Agency and Ken Sale

results.title: Fertilization and birth
results.creator_credit: Wexler Film Productions and Curtis Avery
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live action to describe for young children the reproductive processes from fertilization to birth in fish, birds, animals, and humans. Includes birth sequences of puppies and farm animals. Suitable for primary level.

results.title: Fences
results.brief_description: Early colonial settlers ran sheep on huge unenclosed areas of grazing lands, but when gold was discovered shepherds left the sheep-runs and flocked to the gold-fields. Sheep were “enclosed” and later fences were erected as protection against rabbits and wild dogs.
results.description: Early colonial settlers ran sheep on huge unenclosed areas of grazing lands, but when gold was discovered shepherds left the sheep-runs and flocked to the gold-fields. Sheep were “enclosed” and later fences were erected as protection against rabbits and wild dogs.

results.title: Feminine Fashions in India
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir, Films Division, Government of India and Dilip Jamdar
results.brief_description: Presents the colorful costumes worn by women of India as their daily dress. The sari is the most commonly worn style, others shown include the Rajasthani ghagra, bodice and odhani, salvar kamiz and dupatta of Punjab and garara of Uttar Pradesh.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ezra Mir, Films Division, Government of India and Dilip Jamdar

results.title: Feminine fashions
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and K Khandpur
results.brief_description: The costumes of Indian women and the accessories that go with them. The sari, the most popular dress, and also the pheran of Kashmiri women, the colorful dresses of the Khasi and Naga women of Assam, the salwar and kameez of the Punjab and the gharara and odhuni worn by the young women from Uttar Pradesh.
results.creator_credit_for_label: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and K Khandpur

results.title: Female cycle
results.brief_description: A simple animated explanation of menstruation. It shows how ovaries produce eggs, one of which moves to the surface each month and enters the fallopian tube to travel to the uterus. Secretions from these organs enter the blood and prepare the uterus for the fertilised egg and cause a period.
